oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Bobby Goldsboro
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Bobby Goldsboro (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Recording is from March 25, 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Bobby Goldsboro
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery and Bobby Goldsboro joke about "The Spirit of the West" -- (00:12) Goldsboro's 'The Round-Up Saloon' is discussed -- (00:54) House of Gold publishing company is discussed by Goldsboro and Emery -- (03:41) Emery discusses Goldsboro's snake hunting excursions and his bone issues -- (06:23) Ralph Emery Show exit tune [Featuring Goldsboro and Emery radio spot voiceover] -- (07:37) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Goldsboro and Emery radio spot voiceover] -- (08:20) Goldsboro discusses working with Vikki Carr -- (11:24) Goldsboro recalls his snake hunting excursions -- (15:01) Goldsboro and Emery joke about Joe Sun -- (15:40) Goldsboro discusses his bass fishing expeditions -- (19:58) Emery's attempted trip to Africa for the American Sportsman is recalled by Goldsboro -- (21:30) Goldsboro recalls working on "It's Too Late" for the American Bandstand -- (22:24) Ralph Emery Show exit tune [Featuring Goldsboro and Emery radio spot voiceover] -- (23:40) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Goldsboro and Emery radio spot voiceover] -- (24:56) Emery and Goldsboro discuss Goldsboro's family and Goldsboro's number of injuries -- (26:57) Alabama and Auburn's rivalry is discussed -- (27:37) Goldsboro recalls working in the studio with Del Reeves -- (28:55) Goldsboro's high-strung nature is joked about by Emery and Goldsboro -- (30:38) Goldsboro and Emery discuss the first time they heard themselves talk -- (31:09) The Wright Brothers are told to have opened up for Goldsboro -- (31:38) Emery invites Goldsboro to reflect on the most memorable event from his success -- (33:17) Roger Miller and Glen Campbell are told by Goldsboro to be extremely talented -- (36:31) "Down on the Bayou" is discussed by Goldsboro and Emery -- (36:56) 'Coal Miner's Daughter' is compared to Goldsboro's life -- (38:50) Emery brings up the growing number of celebrity golf tournaments -- (40:05) Ralph Emery Show exit tune [Featuring Goldsboro and Emery radio spot voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Goldsboro, Bobby;
